text: [Music]
in 1898 with the signing of the Treaty
of Paris after the spanish-american war
the u.s. first began its rise as a
superpower a gain control Puerto Rico
the Philippines in Guam the aftermath of
World War two cemented the u.s. along
with the Soviet Union as the world's two
superpowers and with the collapse of the
ladder the u.s. emerged in the early 90s
as the world's sole economic and
military superpower a position it is
more or less held ever since this has in
at least a sense of the American
population created a feeling of
complacency and invincibility in terms
of its military the belief that their
country will always triumph and be
victorious this can be seen in countless
movies TV shows songs and video games
whether the foe be Russia or some
terrorist group or even from outer space
while it is true that right now it is
arguably the most powerful nation in the
world that is slowly beginning to change
but first our sponsor Mira's safety if
you are worried at all about world
events war breaking out terrorist
attacks even natural disasters like
wildfires biological threats either
man-made or from nature or even

it's not something you would normally
think of and something you'd probably
rather not think about but this can make

against it all chemical biological

cabal 10 no space for 10 percent off
your first order check them out at Mira
Safety comm the idea of the u.s. being
unstoppable seems to have its roots in
the aftermath of world war ii the u.s.
emerged victorious over germany and
japan two powerful countries that
dominated vast swaths of the planet with
germany controlling most of europe and
japan much of Asia and the Pacific Ocean
while this victory was absolutely not
one alone the u.s. undoubtedly came out
of World War two in the most
advantageous position
it did not lose millions of soldiers and
citizens its cities were not left in
rubble and its economy destroyed and it
gained massive influence over Western
Europe the Pacific Ocean and eastern
Asia the end of the Cold War only
further reinforced this idea of
supremacy for decades there were only
two superpowers the US and the Soviet
Union with the collapse of the ladder
the u.s. became by far the most powerful
nation on earth no other nation can
match the u.s. in a direct military
confrontation but most defining battles
are not so direct there have been many
battles throughout history where
deception and asymmetrical warfare has
enabled a significantly weaker power to
win the US war in Vietnam and the Soviet
war in Afghanistan are two examples
where a much more powerful military
force was arguably defeated by a much
weaker enemy in 2001 the world's sole
superpower was unable to stop the
terrorist attacks of 9/11 a lightly
armed poorly funded group halfway across
the world was able to inflict more
damage to the US mainland than the
military powerhouses of Germany and
Japan during World War two after 9/11
the general feeling was that the US
would find and destroy this group and
emerged victorious once again after all
if the US could defeat Germany and Japan
after only a few years this war should
be over in a matter of months little did
anyone know that the war in Afghanistan
would end up costing over one trillion
dollars and become the longest war in US
history still going on today in fact
there are those on the opposite side of
this myth those that say since world war
ii the US has never won a single war
from being forced out of North Korea by
the Chinese late in the Korean War to
Vietnam even Afghanistan Iraq Libya and
Syria today this is debatable it all
depends on what you define as winning a
war it can also be argued that the war
in Afghanistan and Iraq was won the u.s.
defeated the militaries of each and took
over control of the government pretty
quickly and at the current role of US
forces in these countries is more that
of law enforcement
one aspect of this myth manifests itself
in regards to weapons the refusal to
believe or admit that a Russian or
Chinese weapon could be superior to that
American one certain land-based air
defenses and many anti-ship missiles for
example I've had many discussions with
people who believe that the s-300 and
even the s400 is inferior to American
Hawk and Patriot air defenses often
calling them quote paper Tigers while no
version of the S 300 or 400 is confirmed
to have been used in combat all
available evidence points toward them
being highly capable systems this
includes its radar specifications range
of the missile the capabilities of
previous Soviet air defenses and more
there has always been an impression in
the u.s. that Russian weaponry is more
brute force using overwhelming firepower
muscling their way through any
deficiencies in technology by using more
weapons larger vehicles and aircraft are
simply throwing more manpower at the
enemy this compared to how they see the
US using more precision weapons with
more advanced technology which is much
more reliable than Soviet and later
Russian weaponry this idea likely dates
back to World War 2 where the Soviet
Union did have to revert to tactics that
are reminiscent of human wave attacks
due to their lack of more advanced
weapons and funding brought about by the
massive damage their economy and
industrial factories received from the
German invasion
however this overall idea is not correct
the Soviet Union was able to develop
some pretty incredibly advanced reliable
and highly capable weapons of war many
of which were superior to that of the US
and today Russia in some ways continues
to do so even during the 1980s where
after a decade of economic stagnation
according to the US Department of
Defense the Soviet Union was leading the
u.s. in twenty eight fields of applied
science and projected to further
increase that lead in the future to 40
while the Soviet Union and later Russia
faced extreme economic difficulty in the
following years their decades of
investment in science and scientists
paid off one obvious example is Russia's
space
program right now the Soyuz rocket and
spacecraft is the only way to get humans
into space if you don't count the
occasional Chinese man launches since
the retirement of the space shuttle the
US has not had any ability to do so some
US launch vehicles even use Russian
rocket engines due to their higher
performance over available American
rocket engines the rd-180 and the rd-180
one are used on the american atlas v an
entire rocket respectively there is also
evidence showing that the US has fallen
behind in another major war fighting
technology hypersonics russia says it
already has active hypersonic missiles
and released images seemed the show
china is developing a hypersonic drone
while the US has tested a few different
hypersonic platforms over the past 20
years these projects appear to have been
canceled now the US has to play catch-up
and this brings up another point after
the end of the Cold War where America
was left as a sole superpower defense
spending dropped dramatically research
and development on cutting-edge weapon
systems was sidelined as there was no
urgent need for such weapons as such the
rate of technological advancement in
terms of defense dropped significantly
on top of this the US Congress was
hesitant to approve many large expensive
new projects instead sticking with
producing more of the same
for example the Patriot air defense
system the harpoon anti-ship missile the
m1 Abrams main battle tank the e2 and
the e3 airborne early warning aircraft
and many many more all having been
designed during the Cold War and still
built and used today now granted each
one of these has been upgraded and
improved in the years since but it is
still the same base platform whereas
during the Cold War multiple generations
with revolutionary new designs and
capabilities were built in the same
period of time another reason for this
myth of the impressions of infallibility
comes down to military spending the u.s.
spends nearly three times more than the
second highest spender China and ten
times more than Russia so it makes sense
to have this impression for the amount
of money being spent on defense
it's weaponry should be the best well
there are many reasons why this is not
always the case
one main one would be compared to China
and Russia US has military bases and as
conducting operations across the world
for 2019 the US has stated to spend more
than the entire defense budget of Russia
in the war on terror in the Middle East
alone the u.s. operates an estimated 800
plus military bases of varying sizes
across the globe the cost of operating
these bases is extremely difficult to
calculate for many reasons but believed
to be around a hundred and fifty billion
dollars a year a nation like China who
operates very few overseas bases and is
not currently involved in any costly
wars can devote much more of the defense
spending to research development and
procurement of weaponry also when you
have less money you tend to be more
frugal with it you cannot afford to
waste money or have costly long
drawn-out experimental projects only to
be canceled a year later and finally the
future currently the US military could
be considered the most powerful in the
world with its massive Navy by far the
largest Air Force in the world and a
large army spread across the earth there
is no other conventional military in the
world that matches it that however does
not mean it's unstoppable even today a
war with Iran could be devastating for
the u.s. Iran has a large arsenal of
conventional and asymmetrical
capabilities there are several large US
air bases well within range of Iranian
missiles and even a Carrier Strike Group
could fall victim to Iran stockpiles of
anti-ship missiles a war with China
would be even worse it would be almost
certainly impossible for the u.s. to
successfully invade the nation China has
built up their military at an incredible
pace over the last two decades and is
only getting more powerful if they
continue at the current rate China will
surpass the US possibly within a decade
the Russian military has also been
growing in size and capability over the
last 20 years with the military growth
of these two along with nations like
Iran and North Korea
America's monopoly on being the sole
world military superpower is
slowly being chipped away those who do
believe in this myth that couldn't
comprehend the possibility that the US
could lose a war may be in for a rude
awakening with the truth slowly but
steadily becoming apparent
